macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Mixed Close on Friday; S&P 500 Flat, Dow Falls 0.6%, Nasdaq Up 0.3%
items.summary: The S&P 500 edged up 2.26 points to 6,915.61, nearly flat, while the Dow Jones dropped 285 points to 49,098.71 and Nasdaq rose to 23,501.24 amid mixed trading and easing geopolitical tensions. Financials and health sectors underperformed, with Treasury yields dipping to 4.23% on the 10-year.

items.title: Intel Tumbles as Wall Street Drifts; Gold Hits Record High
items.summary: Intel shares fell sharply, contributing to market caution, while gold prices rose to another record. CSX climbed 2.4% despite weaker profits due to positive 2026 forecast, and Clorox gained 1.1% on $2.25B acquisition of GOJO Industries.

items.title: US Consumer Sentiment Beats Expectations, Inflation Expectations Cool Ahead of Fed Meeting
items.summary: US consumer sentiment exceeded forecasts with cooling inflation expectations, supporting market sentiment, while business activity shows continued growth per S&P Global. Key tech earnings from Microsoft, Meta, Tesla, ASML expected post-FOMC on January 28.

items.title: Dow Jones Rejects All-Time Highs, Trades in 48,000-49,700 Range
items.summary: Dow Jones rejected recent highs around 49,700, holding support near 49,041 and ranging between 48,000-49,700 ahead of weekend and FOMC. Magnificent 7 and semiconductors led gains, offsetting declines in defensives and financials.

items.title: S&P 500 Ends at 6,915.61 Down 0.35% Weekly; Dow at 49,098.71 Down 0.53%
items.summary: Major indices showed weekly declines: S&P 500 -0.35%, Dow -0.53%, amid Friday's retreat with S&P nearly flat, Nasdaq up slightly, and small caps like US2000 down 1.80%. Year-to-date, indices remain positive with S&P up 13.21% annually.

items.title: Goldman Sachs, Caterpillar Drag Dow Lower; Nvidia, Microsoft Lift
items.summary: Dow fell driven by Goldman Sachs (-2.46%), Caterpillar (-2.00%), American Express (-1.52%), while 3M (+2.09%), Nvidia (+1.80%), Microsoft (+1.38%) provided gains in mixed session.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Cryptocurrency Market Shows Mixed Performance with Notable Gains and Declines
items.summary: On January 24, LPT led gains at 15.91% to $3.308, followed by OM (+1.74%), AXS (+1.06%), RON (+0.93%), and COMP (+0.71%), while SAND dropped 4.94% to $0.155, RENDER -4.52%, ZRO -4.09%, MANA -4.01%, and CRV -3.92%.

items.title: Hotcoin Exchange to List SPACE and FIGHT Tokens with Futures Trading
items.summary: Hotcoin will list SPACE/USDT futures (20x leverage) at 11:00 AM UTC+8 and FIGHT/USDT at 11:30 AM UTC+8 on January 24, backed by U.S. MSB and Australian AUSTRAC licenses.

items.title: PwC Declares Crypto Adoption Has Crossed Irreversible Threshold
items.summary: PwC reports institutional engagement in digital assets like custody, trading, and tokenization has become structural, driven by U.S. regulatory clarity including the GENIUS Act, stablecoin progress, and SEC leadership changes under Paul Atkins.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: GEP Named Leader in 2026 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Source-to-Pay Suites
items.summary: GEP has been positioned as a Leader for the second consecutive year due to its agentic AI platform GEP Qi, which automates procurement and supply chains for enterprises.

items.title: LLMs Achieve 206% Improvement with Codified Expert Knowledge and RAG
items.summary: Researchers developed an AI agent framework that embeds human expert domain knowledge into LLMs, enabling non-experts to generate expert-level simulation data visualizations across engineering domains.

items.title: Yoshua Bengio Warns of AI Power Concentration Risks at Davos 2026
items.summary: AI pioneer Yoshua Bengio highlights the dangers of concentrated AI power controlling economies and calls for global coordination to mitigate potential crises.

items.title: Agentic AI Emerges as 2026's New Operating System for Enterprises
items.summary: Analysts predict 40% of enterprise applications will embed agentic AI by 2026, shifting focus to autonomous systems that act in real-time across industries like defense and logistics.

items.title: Big Five Tech Firms to Invest $600B in GPUs and Data Centers by 2026
items.summary: AI demand is fueling explosive growth in the GPU market and data center power needs, with nuclear energy positioned as a key solution for reliable 24/7 supply.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: GTA 6 Trailer 3 Expected Soon Ahead of November 2026 Launch
items.summary: Rockstar Games is anticipated to release Trailer 3 for GTA 6 on its official channel soon, featuring gameplay footage, soundtrack teasers, and character insights. The game is confirmed for November 19, 2026, after two delays, impacting competitors' release schedules.

items.title: Game File Newsletter Reflects on Gaming Journalism Layoffs
items.summary: Game File's second-year review highlights recent layoffs in gaming media, including Rolling Stone dropping its games writer, The Verge laying off its reporter, and Inverse killing its video game section. It also recaps scoops like NetEase's retreat from Western gaming and Ubisoft canceling an Assassin's Creed title.

items.title: Steam Reveals All Themed Sales for 2026 in Quirky Video
items.summary: Valve announced all themed sales fests for Steam in 2026 via a casual YouTube video featuring toys in a children's room, without specific dates. More details on dates are expected later.

items.title: Tabletop Designers Urge Upper Deck Against Harry Potter Board Game
items.summary: The Tabletop Game Designers Association has called on Upper Deck, publisher of the Legendary series, not to produce a Harry Potter board game following the company's announcement of a licensing deal.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Capital One to Acquire Brex in Landmark $5.15bn Deal
items.summary: Capital One announced a major acquisition of fintech company Brex for $5.15 billion, marking a significant consolidation in the financial technology sector.

items.title: JP Morgan Acquires WealthOS to Boost Pensions Offering
items.summary: JP Morgan has acquired WealthOS to strengthen its pensions and wealth management capabilities.

items.title: Société Générale to Cut 1,800 Jobs in France
items.summary: The French banking giant announced significant workforce reductions of 1,800 positions in France as part of restructuring efforts.

items.title: Airwallex Enters South Korean Market with Paynuri Acquisition
items.summary: Fintech company Airwallex expanded into South Korea through the acquisition of Paynuri, strengthening its presence in the Asian market.

items.title: ThetaRay Names Brad Levy as New CEO
items.summary: Fintech compliance company ThetaRay appointed Brad Levy as CEO, succeeding Peter Reynolds in the leadership role.

items.title: Memory Chip Prices Surge as Supply Constraints Persist Through 2026
items.summary: DRAM prices have increased approximately 50% year-to-date, with NAND flash production already sold out for 2026, driving up costs for storage devices, cameras, and consumer electronics.

items.title: Tech Data Centers Pulled In as Emergency Grid Backstop During Winter Storm
items.summary: US tech data centers are being utilized as emergency power grid support as winter storms threaten power markets.

items.title: Anduril Commits $1B to New California Campus for Defense Tech Expansion
items.summary: Defense technology startup Anduril announced a $1 billion investment in a new Long Beach campus, signaling the industrial-scale growth of the defense-AI sector.
